Message.Title: Agree with changing your search engine to Yahoo
Message.Msg: Agree, this should be done by every stock holder, Now it won't make that much differance if any, but every little bit helps, also everyone that holds this stock should be telling every person they know to try Yahoo home page, family, friends, hell, go around and change the home page at work when nobody is looking to Yahoo. once there they will see how much they have to offer. Facebook came into my work and ran a Facebook Poker Tournament several times before the IPO, they did this to up the numbers of people that they say use Facebook, but most of the people just did it to get into the Tournament and never use the internet. That is important because how companies make money from ad's is to say {we have 100 million or so registered users} advertisers go with that number, then they pay money to get their product out hoping that they will get a % of the total number of registered users. I think it won't be long before you see Yhoo Commercials like the one's from Bing on TV trying to up the number, remember the YHOOOO commercials in the 90's, they worked well.

Message.Title: Sarah Igram, who ran IRS while targetting conservative groups, is spared
Message.Msg: She's now leading Obamacare! Obama is the real problem behind it all such as refusing to protect the US ambassador Benghazi, IRS targetting polical groups, AP phone record scandal. While yahoo news talks about OJ simpson, here's what ABC news says about Sara: Sarah Hall Ingram served as commissioner of the office responsible for tax-exempt organizations between 2009 and 2012. But Ingram has since left that part of the IRS and is now the director of the IRS’ Affordable Care Act office, the IRS confirmed to ABC News today. Her successor, Joseph Grant, is taking the fall for misdeeds at the scandal-plagued unit between 2010 and 2012. During at least part of that time, Grant served as deputy commissioner of the tax-exempt unit. Grant announced today that he would retire June 3, despite being appointed as commissioner of the tax-exempt office May 8, a week ago. As the House voted to fully repeal the Affordable Care Act Thursday evening, House Speaker John Boehner expressed “serious concerns” that the IRS is empowered as the law’s chief enforcer. “Fully repealing ObamaCare will help us build a stronger, healthier economy, and will clear the way for patient-centered reforms that lower health care costs and protect jobs,” Boehner, R-Ohio, said. “Obamacare empowers the agency that just violated the public’s trust by secretly targeting conservative groups,” Rep. Marlin Stutzman, R-Ind., added. “Even by Washington’s standards, that’s unacceptable.”

Message.Title: Hillary on dead US Ambassador in Benghazi -what difference does it make?
Message.Msg: After being pressed by senators including Ron Johnson to explain how it was that over the course of weeks, the Obama Administration stood by an absurd story claiming that four Americans were murdered in Libya due to a spontaneous protest gone bad, outgoing Secretary of State Hillary Clinton played the indignation card. Because she obviously had no answer to justify the ongoing White House deception, Secretary Clinton chose theatrics over a straight answer and clarity: "What difference at this point does it make?!" she howled. What difference does ot make that 4 Americans are dead from Obama and Hillary. What difference does it make that the White House lied to us and tried to cover it up. What a pathetic excuse for a human being. If there was no wrongdoing, then why did Hillary immediately step down from being US Secretary of State? Who should be going to jail for this scandal? A resignation does not offer immunity to crime.

Message.Title: Who in the Obama Administration going to jail for telephone taps at the Associated Press?
Message.Msg: The Justice Department secretly obtained two months of telephone records of reporters and editors for The Associated Press in what the news cooperative's top executive called a "massive and unprecedented intrusion" into how news organizations gather the news. The records obtained by the Justice Department listed outgoing calls for the work and personal phone numbers of individual reporters, for general AP office numbers in New York, Washington and Hartford, Conn., and for the main number for the AP in the House of Representatives press gallery, according to attorneys for the AP. It was not clear if the records also included incoming calls or the duration of the calls. In all, the government seized the records for more than 20 separate telephone lines assigned to AP and its journalists in April and May of 2012. The exact number of journalists who used the phone lines during that period is unknown, but more than 100 journalists work in the offices where phone records were targeted, on a wide array of stories about government and other matters.

Topic.Title: Gabelli & Co. Gives Yahoo a Buy Rating and a $33 Price Target

Message.Msg: More upgrades with Alibaba IPO.

Message.Title: Buy Yahoo: The Party Has Not Yet Started
Message.Msg: Yahoo (YHOO) has been on a tear over the past year, up over 72% over the past 52 weeks and 33% year to date. Yahoo was recently reiterated a Conviction Buy by Goldman Sachs as the company doubles its estimate of Alibaba's valuation to $70 billion. Goldman raised its price target to $30 from $27. Cantor Fitzgerald ups its price target to $30 from $26.

Message.Title: Fundamental Reasons to Buy Yahoo
Message.Msg: There are several fundamental positives for Yahoo currently. Firstly, EPS is up by over 300% this year and is up over 50% quarter over quarter. EPS growth derived from organic sources is one of the most critical factors I consider prior to opening a position in a stock. Additionally, the stock has a PEG ratio of .55. Anything less than one is considered to be undervalued. The company is turning a solid profit with a net profit margin of 67.93%. This means 67 cents out of every dollar they take in goes straight to the bottom line. This is very impressive. The stock's forward P/E ratio is in line at 17.41. Finally, ROE is strong at 30%. These are solid fundamental statistics.

Message.Title: Catalysts For Upside at Yahoo
Message.Msg: Yahoo has several positive catalysts ahead. New Content Deals Yahoo recently announced an SNL deal along with many new content agreements. COO Henrique De Castro describes Yahoo's ad pitch during upfront season as, "Content at scale on the web, delivered in a personalized way." Updated Apps Another positive is Yahoo's new iPhone Weather app has topped iOS weather app charts. Dan Frommer recently stated, "I've seen more normal people talking about it in a good way than any app in a long time." Furthermore, an Android version of Yahoo's revamped flagship app is now out. These are all very positive developments for Yahoo going forward. Yahoo Targeting Younger Demographic CFO Ken Goldman said at the JPMorgan Global Technology, Media and Telecom conference in Boston on Tuesday, "Yahoo plans to ramp up advertising and marketing efforts as it seeks to break its reliance on an 'aging demographic' and become more relevant among young adults. Part of it is going to be just visibility again in making ourselves cool, which we got away from for a couple of years." He went on to say Yahoo's brand will be more visible on outdoor billboards and at sporting events. The company is pursuing the 18-to-34 demographic. I see these developments as huge positives for the stock. These new opportunities may be what provides the next leg up for the stock.

Message.Title: Yahoo Japan up over 100% , stock split a wapping 100 to 1
Message.Msg: In a meeting of the Board of Directors held today, Yahoo Japan Corporation decided to implement a stock split and adopt the Tangen share unit system. The stock split and adoption of the Tangen share unit system are contingent on the approval of partial revisions of the Company's articles of incorporation at the 18th ordinary shareholders' meeting scheduled to be held on June 20, 2013. Details are as follows. I. Purpose behind Stock Split and Adoption of Tangen Share Unit System The Company has decided to contribute to the greater convenience and liquidity of the stock market on which its shares are listed by implementing a stock split (100 for 1 stock split) and adopting the Tangen share unit system.

Message.Title: Favorable Legal Ruling
Message.Msg: Yahoo! announced that the Superior Court of Justice for the Federal District in Mexico has granted the company’s appeal and reversed the ruling of the 49th Civil Court of Mexico, which had entered a non-final judgment of $2.75B against Yahoo! and Yahoo! Mexico on November 28, 2012. The appellate decision overturned all monetary awards against Yahoo! and reduced the monetary award against Yahoo! Mexico to $172,500. Yahoo! Mexico was awarded $2.6M in the original judgment, and this award was confirmed by the appellate decision

Message.Title: Excellent Chance to Get Yahoo Now.
Message.Msg: Anyone on the sidelines waiting to get in, this now your great entry point. It's far more than just the powerful Alibaba IPO which will blow through $100B, and the growth that Marissa Mayer will be able to drive more and more as she turns the ship with new advertising revenue through mobilizing Yahoo, or the content monetizing that is such an obvious revenue source, or the fact that even "search" has turned around, but then there is the inevitable bidding war that is going to take place over Yahoo whether Dan Loeb and Marissa Mayer want it or not, it will happen. Those who get on board now will make a lot of money; those who wait will kick themselves for it for years. Carpe Diem! This is your moment.

Message.Title: Banks at 5 1/2 Year High
Message.Msg: By Sara Sjolin, MarketWatch LONDON (MarketWatch) — U.K.’s benchmark was back on a strong footing on Friday, after breaking a 10-day winning streak the prior day, with banks advancing after a broker upgrade and oil firms showing positive moves. The FTSE 100 index UK:UKX +0.53% climbed 0.5% to 6,723.06, closing at the highest level since October 2007. On the week, the index gained 1.5%. Banks posted some of the biggest gains, after analysts at UBS lifted European banks and diversified financials to overweight from underweight with a preference for Nordic and U.K. banks. Additionally they singled out, Royal Bank of Scotland Group PLC UK:RBS +5.65% RBS +6.39% as one of its favorite picks, sending it shares 5.7% higher. Reuters Banks rise in London, after UBS lifts the European banking sector to neutral, with a preference in U.K. stocks. Lloyds Banking Group PLC UK:LLOY +3.17% LYG +3.36% gained 3.2%, Barclays PLC UK:BARC +2.00% BCS +2.79% put on 2% and HSBC Holdings PLC UK:HSBA +1.28% HBC +1.10% rose 1.3%. Shares of Wm Morrison Supermarkets PLC UK:MRW +1.38% picked up 1.4%, after it announced a long-term agreement with online retailer Ocado Group PLC UK:OCDO +35.76% , which will enable Morrison’s to deliver groceries to customers’ homes by January 2014. Shares of Ocado soared 36%. Oil firms were also providing support in London, tracking oil prices higher. BG Group PLC UK:BG +1.36% advanced 1.8%, Royal Dutch Shell PLC UK:RDSB +1.05% RDS.B +0.73% gained 1.1% and BP PLC UK:BP +0.89% BP +0.51% added 0.9%. Most mining firms also closed out the day in positive territory, even as metals prices were mixed. Anglo American PLC UK:AAL +1.36% added 1.4%, BHP Billiton PLC UK:BLT +0.89% gained 0.9% and Rio Tinto PLC UK:RIO +0.75% RIO +0.38% AU:RIO +1.12% rose 0.8%. On a more downbeat note, shares of Intertek Group PLC UK:ITRK -1.94% lost 1.9%, after the product-testing firm said a fall in revenue from the minerals sector reduced margins for the four...

Topic.Title: Can you believe hotmodel still posts here?

Message.Msg: Okay, enough from you. I know who you are. I am through with the games. You forget your use of the word 'wrath' gave you away 100%. Before that I was not sure. LOL of course the email would get delivered it is your id. DUH. From things that have happened over the year - I now believe you are the same. I'm sorry if that offends you. It bothered me when I realized. I was shocked to be honest. I never asked you to fight my fight. Geez. I have fought my own fight my entire life - I don't depend on others. Sorry if I gave that impression. You called me a cat lady passive-aggressive & lonely first Hugh - you were the one last year - when I allowed to yell at me way too many times - or do you forget that - that told me you get what you give. So when you attack me I attack back...for the longest time on this board I allowed many of you to attack & said very little. So out of the blue in the Fall - COLD & the gang started to attack me _ and you are trying to tell me that is not suspcious. I think it is. Maybe you can't go back and see many of your posts from this time last year - but I can. Funny that cold & the gang never once interrupted you or jangles or mb or grey when we were going back & forth. I'm sorry - but I will use my limited intellegence to say that was very odd. It is not a lie & you yourself admitted that - i'll find the post if you like. You laughed & said we'll keep that between us. Listen, I have no beef with you, but I am being pushed off the board for a reason - & we both know why. I will not be bullied into anything. Because I am an independent person, I will make the decision when & if I leave here. Wow, a condescending #$%$...uh ... sorry ...no.. I can't accept that description of me. Although if your aim was to hurt you succeeded. No I'm a pretty good person who likes to laugh & have fun & likes the people I care about to be happy & taken care of. You don't know the first thing about me.

Topic.Title: "Yahoo Board to Meet Sunday to Consider $1.1 Billion, All-Cash Deal to Acquire Tumblr"

Message.Msg: It's basically a blog. I was toying with starting one. This is a description from their about page: Tumblr lets you effortlessly share anything. Post text, photos, quotes, links, music, and videos from your browser, phone, desktop, email or wherever you happen to be. You can customize everything, from colors to your theme's HTML

Message.Title: Info on Tumblr
Message.Msg: I found this website that had a nice breakdown on some financial stats of tumblr kanguroDOTfi/blog/who-uses-tumblr-17-statistics-marketers-need-to-know-about-tumblr/ Replace DOT with . Seventeen Statistics Marketers Need To Know About Tumblr Users There are currently 102 million Tumblr blogs (Source) 44.6 billion posts have been published on Tumblr (Source) Tumblr attracted 29.2 million unique visitors (ComScore) 6.6 billion page views in March 2013 (comScore) Tumblr’s audience is among the youngest with 45% being under 35 years old. (Source) 47% of US Tumblr users are male (Source) 35% of Tumblr users make less than $30k annually (Source) 65% of Tumblr’s audience has a college education (Source) Only 33% of Tumblr users have children (Source) Hispanics and African-Americans make up 29% of Tumblr’s audience (Source) There are 2x more Hispanics than the internet average (Source) Tumblr has more page views from a computer browser than from a mobile device browser in the United States (Source) Tumblr is visited more by computers at home than computers at work in the United States (Source) Tumblr is more popular with 13-25 year olds than Facebook (Source) Average user spends 23 minutes on Tumblr per visit (Source) As of April 2013 the top 5 countries using tumblr are: US, Brazil, UK, Canada and Russia (Source) California uses Tumblr the most in US, with 8,452,521 monthly unique visitors in April 2013 (Source)

Topic.Title: Info on Tumblr

Message.Msg: good info. Thanks

Topic.Title: Info on Tumblr

Message.Msg: Nice. There are some stats on their about page - but this is great information. Nice find

Topic.Title: Changing The Game..

Message.Msg: My take is that this weekend MM will get ok to buy Tumblr and it will be announced with Flickr update in NY. My gut feeling MM will be successful with negotiation with Tumblr.

Topic.Title: Changing The Game..

Message.Msg: If they get Tumblr this is huge to YHOO .

Topic.Title: "Yahoo Board to Meet Sunday to Consider $1.1 Billion, All-Cash Deal to Acquire Tumblr"

Message.Msg: I've been trying to envision how it all fits together. I think it will take some time to merge Tumblr with Yahoo! From what I am reading Karp had to be convinced to hitch his baby to Yahoo! - I think he would have had an issue with any larger corp buying into his co. Once again though I think it's a testament to Mayer that this deal is happening at all. A few weeks back Tumblr let go of several editors they had hired only last year. It was an experiment they were trying called Storyboard. I wonder if this was in the works at that time. Anyway at that time they floated the idea that Karp very much needed his "sheryl sandberg" I would say he has that in Mayer, albeit in a slightly different way.

Topic.Title: Changing The Game..

Message.Msg: I think the negotiation phase is pretty much done. The board is voting on Sunday.

Topic.Title: Short Squeeze on Monday?

Message.Msg: $28 on Tuesday.

Message.Msg: 26 million shares short will want to get out or burn.

Topic.Title: Info on Tumblr

Message.Msg: I don't know what to make of this.... I guess we just keep out faith in MM and hope she make great use of this business. Integrate it well and leverage it somehow across other yahoo properties. $1.1bil is not cheap considering they only had $13mil in rev last year. I hope tumblr is to yahoo what youtube is to google. Only time will tell...

Topic.Title: Changing The Game..

Message.Msg: I want to see ads on Flickr. Can't keep giving this service away for free. Lets monetize the app please and grow core yahoo! We are all waiting to see core growth...

Topic.Title: Changing The Game..

Message.Msg: This is done deal. No doubt BOD will approve it. We could be a $1 up Monday. Combo of Flickr and Tumblr will beat Instegram and eventually competitive against YouTube . Perfect for MM mobile strategy

Message.Title: Yahoo To Announce Tumblr Buyout Monday
Message.Msg: The deal is done at $1.1 Billion. The Yahoo board will approve it on Sunday followed by an announcement on Monday. Yahoo will move up on the news.
